properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 7 at 9:17AM EST until January 9 at 9:15AM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a Flood
Advisory for the Congaree River...

Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland
Counties

.Increased discharges from upstream reservoirs, combinbed with recent
rainfall are causing high flows and nuisance flooding along the Congaree
River.

The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a
* Flood Advisory for
The Congaree River At Columbia.
* until Thursday morning.
* At  9 AM Tuesday the stage was 8.2 feet.
* Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise this afternoon and crest at 10.4 feet
after midnight tonight.
* Advisory stage is 10.0 feet.
* At 10.0 feet...Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and
downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs on parts of the
Cayce and West Columbia river walk.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means that nuisance flooding may occur nearest the
river when the level is below the official flood stage.
